message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyze the impact of agricultural subsidies using data from the Agricultural Resource Management Survey and the 2017 Census of Agriculture.", "dataset": ["Agricultural Resource Management Survey", "2017 Census of Agriculture"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This research draws on survey data collected by the World Bank to investigate the relationship between access to electricity and economic competitiveness in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank survey data"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using a combination of household surveys and remote sensing data from the LandSat satellite program, we examine how climate change impacts household welfare and food security in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["household surveys", "remote sensing data from the LandSat satellite program"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This article analyzes debt distress in low-income countries using datasets on financial flows from the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund.", "dataset": ["World Bank financial flows dataset", "International Monetary Fund financial flows dataset"], "topic": ["Debt"]}, {"sentence": "To study the impact of mobile technology on financial inclusion, we use mobile phone usage data from a large telecommunications firm and household-level survey data.", "dataset": ["mobile phone usage data", "household-level survey data"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "We compare disaster preparedness strategies across several countries in the Pacific region, using datasets on disaster risk management from the United Nations and national governments.", "dataset": ["United Nations disaster risk management dataset", "national government disaster risk management dataset"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Regional Integration"]}, {"sentence": "We estimate the causal effect of education on economic growth in African countries, using panel data from the Education Management Information System and the World Development Indicators database.", "dataset": ["Education Management Information System", "World Development Indicators database"], "topic": ["Education", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines the adoption of renewable energy technologies in developing countries, using data from the International Renewable Energy Agency and national surveys of government officials and business owners.", "dataset": ["International Renewable Energy Agency data", "national government surveys"], "topic": ["Energy", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "To assess the environmental impact of mining activities, we use satellite imagery and ground-level measurements from the Global Monitoring for Environment and Security program and administrative data on mining licenses and permits.", "dataset": ["Global Monitoring for Environment and Security satellite imagery and ground-level measurements", "administrative data on mining licenses and permits"], "topic": ["Environment", "Extractive Industries"]}, {"sentence": "We examine the relationship between gender and entrepreneurship in South Asian countries, using microdata from household surveys conducted by national statistical offices and international development organizations.", "dataset": ["household survey microdata", "international development organization microdata"], "topic": ["Gender", "Jobs & Development"]}]
